result.execSummary:
The defendant John T Kirby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC AMENDED FROM PCS W/INTENT TO DELIVER OR MANUFACTURE THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA and follow through with treatment. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

timeConds.notes: Huber is granted for school. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances. Absolute sobriety is required.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ZCI
Preliminary hearing on January 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***TO BE CO-SIGNED BY FATHER: JOHN T KIRBY SR.  D.O.B.-03-24-1956***  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Shall reside with parents and follow all of their rules and regulations.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant John T Kirby in court with attorney Robert W Keller.  Defendant John T Kirby in custody.  James D Newlun appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
